fields.title: Samvera Community Welcomes Amigos Library Services as Newest Service Provider Partner

content.value: The Samvera Community is pleased to announce that
Amigos Library Services
(Amigos)
has joined as our newest
Service Provider Partner
, reinforcing their commitment to the continued growth and sustainability of Samvera’s open-source solutions.

Amigos is a 501(c)3 non-profit membership-based organization dedicated to serving libraries through the sharing of collections, services, and opportunities. With nearly 500 members, including public, academic, and special libraries across Texas, Missouri, Arkansas, Oklahoma, New Mexico, Arizona, and Kansas, Amigos is well-positioned to represent the diverse needs of libraries and cultural institutions of diverse sizes and contexts.
Over the past year, Amigos has been an active collaborator within the Samvera Community, particularly in advancing the
Hyku

multi-tenant repository platform. Their contributions include the development of new features for the Hyku community version, such as ETD (Electronic Theses and Dissertations) and OER (Open Educational Resources) work types, flexible metadata options, and the integration of Hyrax 5 and its updated dependencies. Amigos staff have also supported the community through product testing, documentation, and infrastructure and deployment solutions.

As a Samvera Partner, Amigos plans to deepen its engagement by contributing additional code and enhancements, expanding support for testing and documentation, and offering expertise informed by its broad membership base. They also aim to develop a shared Hyku service to help member libraries meet their repository needs while fostering collaborative resource sharing across the region.

“Amigos’ active participation and technical contributions have already strengthened the Samvera ecosystem,” said Heather Greer Klein, Samvera Community Manager. “We are excited to welcome them as a Partner and look forward to their continued leadership in building sustainable, flexible repository solutions.”

In becoming a Partner, Amigos commits to the principles outlined in the Samvera Community’s Bylaws: contributing resources, participating in governance, staying informed on security issues, and helping shape the technical and strategic direction of the community.
The Samvera Community extends a warm welcome to Amigos Library Services to Samvera Partnership.
Learn more about Samvera Partnership
and how it enables collaboration, powers good open source governance, and ensures the sustainability of our critical shared digital repository infrastructure.

fields.title: Samvera Connect 2025: Explore the Full Program & Save with Early Bird Registration

content.value: The
full program for Samvera Connect 2025
is now live! Join us in Mexico City this October for four days of learning, sharing, and connecting with the Samvera community.
The program includes:
A half-day of workshops to kick things off
Two days of plenary sessions featuring participants from across the community
Keynote address from a leading Latin American repository expert (details coming soon)
Repository Showcases and lightning talks highlighting real-world projects
Interest & Working Group roundtables plus dedicated networking time
Tuesday evening reception to relax and connect
Flexible final half-day with unconference sessions, a Partner meeting, and a developer meet-up
Early bird registration is only $200 through September 5.
See the full schedule, review all the details, and
register today at the Samvera Connect 2025 website.
We can’t wait to see you in Mexico City!

fields.title: Deadline extended to July 28th! Call for Proposals for Samvera Connect 2025 Mexico City

content.value: The
Samvera Connect 2025
Program Committee has extended the deadline for our
Call for Proposals for presentations, panels, lightning talks, and posters
to July 28th.
This year’s conference will be held in person from October 20–23, 2025, in Mexico City.

With your participation we can create a rich and inclusive program that reflects the diversity of experience within the Samvera Community—from newcomers exploring adoption to long-time contributors and expert practitioners.
We welcome proposals on all topics related to Samvera Community technologies and the broader ecosystem of open repositories.
Suggested areas include (but are not limited to):
Case studies and implementation stories
Local migrations and integrations
Repository management and outreach
Development workflows and customizations
Accessibility: challenges and solutions
Metadata practices and innovations

We encourage proposals tailored to any segment of our community, including developers, repository managers, sysadmins, metadata librarians, administrators, and all others involved in Samvera-related work.
Proposal formats:
20-minute presentations
40-minute panels, with a moderated discussion between panelists and a Q&A
5-minute lightning talks
Posters
Submission deadline: July 28th, 2025
Submit your proposal on Sched
We look forward to your ideas and to shaping a conference program that informs, inspires, and connects our community.
